intro: Dactylostemon communis, commonly known as the common dactylostemon, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves and produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
